Legal_Issue: Whether FMV method can be used for tax calculation when customer supplies materials
Evidence_Assessment: Review of applicable laws, memoranda (ET 207), and submissions
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiff to justify use of FMV method
Legal_Rule: FMV cannot be used if customer supplies materials; all material costs must be included in tax calculation
Standard_of_Review: Statutory interpretation of Excise Tax Act and administrative guidance
Procedural_Issue: Retroactive change in tax calculation method not permitted
Grounds_for_Claim: Plaintiff sought refund based on switch from determined value to FMV method
Review_Standard: Interpretation of statutory provisions and policy memoranda
Key_Evidence_Considered: Revenue Canada's representations, Excise Tax Act, Memorandum ET 207
Legal_Framework: Excise Tax Act and administrative memoranda
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged assessment by seeking refund via method change
Defendant_Response: Opposed retroactive method change and use of FMV with customer-supplied materials
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, statutory provisions, administrative guidance
Remedy_Sought: Tax refund based on FMV method
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Improper use of FMV method under the Act
Governing_Rule: Memorandum ET 207 and Excise Tax Act provisions on valuation methods
